name: Melia Cayo Coco

reviews.text: Myself and my partner both travelled here on the 11th December from Manchester and travelled back on Christmas day!
reviews.title: Crazy Christmas in Cayo Coco
Can't wait to go back
reviews.text: We absolutely loved the place and there should be no worries about going here. The place is out of this world.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: The staff - you couldn’t get any better people. They are all so so friendly and go out of their way to say hello.

A big hello to Joe from the beach bar.... he's excellent and knows how to make a good drink... especially the mojito which my boyfriend had plenty of! Orlando and hoseff from the bar with the pool tables, they are absolutely great and also know how to make the good drinks! Philippe the gardener, he makes you beautiful birds and hats from the coconut leaves, he’s lovely and also a massive shout out to all the entertainment staff, especially Ismary & Okie (sorry if it spelt wrong) who certainly know how to keep everyone entertained and they are all very chatty and make you feel very very welcome.
reviews.title: Fantastic place * * * * *

reviews.text: The rooms are huge; they’re clean and very comfy. They have a balcony, bedside tables and a large dressing table with mirror and also a big full mirror. Every girls dream for getting ready for the night out. The bathroom is clean and lovely too with a double wardrobe, also an ironing board and iron and safe which is free and you just input your own code to lock and unlock and the air con is a godsend and very cool.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel, great staff

reviews.text: We just got back on Monday from our honeymoon after spending a week at the Melia. I am not writing this to complain because it was truely a lovely vacation, however this resort is not a 5* as stated by the tour operator. We went down with high expectations about this resort and the only disappointment was the ROOM situation. Our 1st room had a large amount of aunts all around. This did not bother me but annoyed me a bit because it took 3 calls plus a few visits to the front desk to get this matter looked at. Then we opened the closed to find a hole in the wall where brown water was coming from. It made my stomach turn, because mold is not safe. After calling the front desk again, I was asked to talk to the customer service person where this matter was taken care of. He was amazing like all the staff at this resort..however things got done when they felt like doing it. We were upgraded to one of the lagoon rooms which I have to say was amazing, super clean and great view. Another problem occured with the room..toliet did not work,no towels and not to mention no toliet rolls..my only complaint is about the rooms and the luck we had. I thought I would share this to let you know that that this resort is not a 5* plus, more like a 4*. Not saying that I would not recommend this hotel, but do not expect a 5*. Have to mention though the property is very nice, super clean, staff so friendly and always smiling, weather was great, pool area very nice (water freezing). Food was not the greatest, however lets remember that you do not go away for the food. Bread was always fresh and just out of the oven. Highly recommend! Very close to the airport, if wanting to shop not to much to buy unless you leave the resort. I did not feel that if you did not tip you did not get service. Service was great either way, just the room situation was a nightmare and could have been avoided if matters were taken care of on the 1st complaint.
reviews.title: Room nightmare, however nice resort
Wonderful Experiences!
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Melia Cayo Coco the first time in March 2004. We loved it so much we went back in March 2005, and brought 13 of our friends with us! I have been all around the Carribean and always have fun and great service wherever we go. But I have to say that I feel that I have found my home away from home at Melia Cayo Coco!

reviews.title: We had a lovely time
reviews.text: I have to say that I have never loved a resort so much as I have Melia Cayo Coco. We experienced good service in all areas. I often was without anything but my swim suit. I never felt that I HAD to give a tip and certainly didn't receive substandard service if I didn't leave a tip. Five of our group were scuba divers. We had 8 amazing dives and the crew were very well trained and nobody was left feeling that they were neglected.

reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel
reviews.text: Other members of our group went on several of the day trips and had a ton of fun and loved being able to see Moron and to go on the Jungle Cruise. Speed boats were so much fun that my hubby and I went on that tour 2 times! The room was always clean (THANK You Mayline)and the front desk was always happy to serve and make change. Thanks Isory.

I really don't understand why some patrons didn't enjoy their stay at the resort....but I have to say that if they really must then perhaps they can stay away and make more room for me and my friends! I definitly plan to come back a 3rd and 4th time.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in - Avoid at all costs
A Pretty Good Overall Vacation
reviews.text: Just returned from a week-long vacation at the Melia Cayo Coco resort between October 23-30, 2005. We are a couple in our late 20's from Quebec, Canada. We had originally booked to visit Sandals Royal Hicacos in Varadero, however due to hurricane Wilma we were forced to change our travel plans at the very last minute (the day before departure) and were lucky enough to get two last minute seats on Air Canada and a booking at the Melia Cayo Coco resort.

reviews.title: Ignore ALL negative reviews!!!! "This place is fabulous!
reviews.text: Flight: Our flight down with Air Canada was excellent. No delays, no complaints about the service, just a little turbulent due to the hurricane!

Resort Room: The resort is quite a nice place to stay, we stayed in a 2nd floor garden view suite which had two beds pushed together to form a sort of large, king-size bed. This was nice but slightly annoying as there was a crack down the middle between the two beds. Our room was always immaculately cleaned by the maid who left beautiful towel arrangements on our bed each day. The room safes in the resort operate by numeric code which you program yourself, so there's never any worries about losing keys and such, which is great. Our room had a beautiful large balcony with two chairs and a table on it overlooking the tennis courts at the resort. The air conditioning in the room was way, way stronger than we needed for the weather we had. It didn't seem to be adjustable according to temperature and rather seemed to have only two settings: full-blast or off, which at times left us feeling slightly chilly but when that happened we just opened the patio door for a bit to let the cold air out and the warm air in.
reviews.title: Did we go to a different hotel?
First trip to Cuba - loved it
reviews.text: Beach: The beach is beautiful although we didn't get to use it much during our stay due to huge waves and poor weather as a result of the hurricane. When we did get to swim, it was lovely. The beach is a little bit more narrow than at Varadero but still very beautiful with soft sand and turquoise water, and it is kept well-groomed by resort staff. During our beach days we saw two large jellyfish washed up on the beach - be careful of these! I understand they can sting.

reviews.title: Dissapointed with the Melia Cayo Coco
reviews.text: Pool: There is a beautiful huge pool at the resort, right in the middle. A nice place to swim when the water at the beach is too rough. It is not too deep, about up to my neck at the deepest (I'm 5'4") so is good for non-swimmers to enjoy as well. We got to enjoy the pool for a couple of days, then for some reason the management decided it needed to be immediately and completely drained out for cleaning! So right in the middle of our stay, the pool was completely drained making it totally unuseable at the same time as the beach was too choppy (red flag) for swimming! I found the whole situation hilarious, but some of the other tourists were not amused about that! The pool remained empty for two or three days as Cuban staff worked about, mopping and cleaning it, however eventually it was re-filled after many complaints (although not from us - like I said I just found it funny). We were told they drain the pool for "cleaning" once every two years. So anyone coming after us until 2007 should be ok as far as the draining thing goes! Anyway the staff offered to transport us by bus to another resort where we could swim if we wanted to so it wasn't like we were entirely unable to do so.

reviews.title: don't listen to the negative coments this place is great!!!
reviews.text: First of all let me say, don't read the negative comments listed. Some people would complain in their own living rooms.

reviews.title: Service seemed to depend on tipping
reviews.text: We stayed for a week from Jan 13 to 20/06. The resort was absolutely spottless, very, very, clean.

reviews.title: This is our Favourite so Far
reviews.text: You would constantly see the workers cleaning and helping the tourists. Extremely friendly staff that goes out off there way to accomodate you.
The rooms were excellent in size and design,ironing board included with iron and hair dryer as well.
reviews.title: NIce place - but not up to par with other options

reviews.text: Nice size balcony to sit and relax. I visited the other hotels in Caya Coco, and many of them had the wind tunnel blowing through the front lobby as the wind blew in from the ocean. THIS HOTEL DID NOT, you could sit in the lobby at night and relax or have a
reviews.title: December Get Away

description: Located beachfront in Cayo Coco, habitat of a large colony of pink flamingos. Five-Star All Inclusive Resort with 250 rooms. Conceived only for adults aged 18 years or more. Its superior suites and rooms are built on stilts over a natural seawater lagoon. Recommended for couples, weddings, and honeymoons.Guest Rooms250 rooms: 168 Standard, 62 Standard Superior Lagoon, 6 Junior Suite, 2 Junior Suite Deluxe Lagoon, 12 Suite Deluxe LagoonDining4 Restaurants (A la Carta, Buffet, Barbeque), 5 Bars
